data.title: Confirming argv[0] has a non-zero value
data.body: This little if statement just confirms that argv[0] got a non-zero value. Since as is a junk value can be concatenated with .so and dlopen will search for the file, this helps prevents that. It shouldn't slow down execution most the time too much, and should help in cases where something has gone wrong. The printf value could be changed to something others find more appropriate.

data.title: Fix axis check in Box3F::extend method
data.body:
Box3F::extend only checks the axis once. This is incorrect behaviour for an extend method as for example if we have a point which satisfies both `p.AXIS < minExtents.AXIS` and `p.AXIS > maxExtents.AXIS` only minExtent.AXIS will get set.

This pull request fixes the aforementioned issue.

data.title: Not working - Advanced Texture Maps - Overlay Map
data.body: Is this already know bug? I don't find a issue open.

data.title: Adds the RotationF utility math class.
data.body:
The class is designed as a general-purpose rotation/orientation class to make it easy to work with rotations and swap between math types as easily as possible.

Cleaned up second go at this, with some reorginizations and fixes.

data.title: Set textures as bitmapctrl in script
Select camera when in material editor crashfix.
data.body:
When attempting to select a camera Object(so going into the editor, going into the freefloating camera and then back to the player camera and selecting the freefloating one) while the material editor was open, it would crash because it attempts to access the shapebase object's shapeInstance - but cameras don't have a shape.

This fixes it so it makes sure there's a shapeinstance before trying to get the material data.

Pertains to #1486

data.title: unable to find object and then freezed for 1sec.
corrects native file dialogue return values
alternate to https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/1602
updated empty template …
data.body: with stray script files from devhead that had yet to be converted as of  May 5, 2016

data.title: Correct SpinLight animation. https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/…
data.body: …issues/1601

data.title: spinlight animation don't work
data.body: I'm using the last develop version, the spinLight animation type from spotLight don't work, the last working version was from 3.8-RC. Something in between v3.8-RC and v3.8 broke this. I think we need to fixed before v4.

data.title: T3D don't compile "epoxy/gl.h': No such file"
data.body:
Hi I just download the new version of torque3d I can't compile the damn thing hahaha

1>C:/Game Develop/Game Engine/T3D/Engine/source/gfx/gl/tGL/tGL.h(26): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'epoxy/gl.h': No such file or directory

I'm bit lose right now with all the changes but in the commit change I notice this "Merge pull request #1567: Added Epoxy in favor of GLEW" may be something was missing.

data.title: Added missing OpenGL profiling blocks.
data.body: Please check to make sure I put these in the right places. There's a couple that I had to leave out from the D3D9 ones because they didn't make sense, but I tried to match as many as I could.

data.title: replaces GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER_ARB with GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER
data.body: They have the same constant value, but we are not using the ARB extension, so doing this for consistency's sake.

data.title: OpenGL Extension Caching
data.body:
This caches OpenGL extensions that are not part of the core profile. It uses a struct of Boolean values to avoid function call overhead as @rextimmy suggestion. Extensions that run during initalization are not cached, as there really is no reason to as of now. It is fairly easy to add more extensions to the cache as needed. 

This PR also removes the old extensions that are no longer needed.

Finally, it replaces a call of glGenMipmapEXT to glGenMipmap, as we are in the core profile now!

data.title: removes FrameAllocatorMarker usage from GL side _fastTextureLoad
data.body: Repeatedly caused issues with 4096^2 atlases

data.title: Rolls back OGL Projection correction.
data.body: Epoxy looks to handle the projection depth range so it behaves more like D3D, so this change was doubling up and causing problems.

data.title: Fixes the cmake blacklist filter it not using SDL
data.body: Fixes the blacklist filter in the event we aren't using SDL to avoid including an unwanted file dialog codefile.

data.title: Native File Dialogs
data.body:
Integrates the nativeFileDialog library to enable native file dialogs on the major platforms. It is activated with SDL.

Major assistance in getting this working properly from @Azaezel

data.title: GFXDrawUtil::_drawSolidPolyhedron rendering incorrect.
data.body: This is more a reminder for myself in case i forget.  GFXDrawUtil::_drawSolidPolyhedron is rendering incorrect after GFXTriangleFan was removed, easy way to see it is when clicking on trigger in the world editor.

data.title: Re-enable destruction of PhysicsShapes.
data.body: Adds in some missing script functions that let projectiles damage and destroy physics shapes.

data.title: missing samplerstate configurations
GFXDynamicTextureProfile
data.body: Certain plugins were not playing nice on the directx end with updating rendertargets. Provides a profile for targets intended to be continuously updated.

data.title: Empty template not working with deferred shading
data.body:
I just downloaded a clean version of Torque 3D, latest version.
I created a project based on 'Empty', and it didn't work, but the 'Full' version worked just fine.
Turns out the Empty template was missing a bunch of shaders and stuff like that for the deferred shading pipeline. I don't know exactly how much it missed, but it lacked "deferredShading.cs" for one.

data.title: Profiler toggle and World Editor menu entry.
data.body:
Makes the profiler pop-up act on a toggle, and also adds an entry into the World Editor's Tool menu to easily activate it.

Dependent on the World Editor's menubar addition in #1586.

data.title: Expose Network Sim fields on NetGraph gui
data.body:
Adds 2 fields to expose the net simulation functionality more readily to the NetGraph GUI.

Also added a Tools option to the World Editor menubar, with the NetGraph as the first option to make it easier to activate the NetGraph in the editor.

data.title: Make exec() and getDSOPath() proper Con namespace functions.
data.body:
Moves the console function exec()'s body into an actual function in the Con namespace as the function executeFile() to align with the other execute and eval functions.

Also moved the getDSOPath function(as exec/executeFile requires it) from being local in consoleFunctions.cpp to a Con namespace function as well, furthering the consistency.

data.title: Adds the RotationF math class.
data.body: The class is designed as a general-purpose rotation/orientation class to make it easy to work with rotations and swap between math types as easily as possible.

data.title: exposes several datablock entries to the particle editor gui subsystem
data.body:
windCoefficient, animateTexture, framesPerSec, animTexFrames*, animTexTiling

*at time of writing, it will read and write this entry to disk, but will not update in realtime. via the handcoded editing tool.
